page.title: 19OLD GATE POST IN GWERSYLLT
page.content: In the north east corner of our school field is a black metal post about three metres high with a cone shaped top. Mr. Samuel Roger Shone aged 78,who lived in Gwersyllt as a child, remembers the railway line which ran from the Gwersyllt Colliery taking coal to the main railway line to Wrexham.The post is one of the posts of a gate which acted as a level crossing across the railway line.One of the hinge pins can still be seen. The post is made of two pieces of railway line placed side by side.The cone top kept out the rain.Mr.Shone remembers that the gates opened twice a day. There was a wooden footbridge across the line carrying the footpath from Summerhill to Holy Trinity School.The boys from the school often played on the bridge.
